Pittsburgh.Oliver Building (Pittsburgh):
The Henry W. Oliver Building is a 25-story, 106 m (348 ft) skyscraper at 535 Smithfield Street, across from Mellon Square in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. The building was designed by Daniel Burnham and built 1908-10, consisting of a stone and terra cotta facade over a steel frame. It cost $3.5 million ($95.3 million today)


== History ==
The structure was completed as per the parameters of its namesake's will.
